text: James "Winky" Hicks is a bluegrass musician and instrument maker from Grove Hill, Alabama. Hicks is a regular at fiddlers festivals, where he plays the banjo with his band, the Frontier Bluegrass. Besides string instruments such as mandolins, he also makes turkey yelpers. In 2011, he was named a "Black Belt Treasured Artist" by the Black Belt Treasures Cultural Arts Center, a non-profit from Camden, Alabama. ==References== Category:Living people Category:American bluegrass musicians Category:American banjoists Category:Luthiers Category:American musical instrument makers Category:People from Grove Hill, Alabama Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Country musicians from Alabama
title: Winky Hicks
